Name: GLOBAL_SOFAConventions
Comment: This conventions stores Ambisonic RIRs derived from RIRs recorded along the spherical surface of an ambisonic microphone and with the excitation signal played back by an ambisonic source.

Name: GLOBAL_SOFAConventionsVersion
Comment: By default, 1rst order Ambisonics is used both for the source and microphone (hence 4 channels). By default, 3 microphone positions are used, each with 4 source positions (hence M = 12).

Name: GLOBAL_DatabaseName
Comment: name of the database to which these data belong

Name: GLOBAL_AmbisonicListener
Comment: Information about the microphone used for the IRs measurements

Name: GLOBAL_AmbisonicListenerOrder
Comment: Degree of the Spherical Harmonic Expansion of the IRs

Name: GLOBAL_AmbisonicListenerConversionMethod
Comment: Description of the procedure used to transform listener raw data into Ambisonics

Name: GLOBAL_AmbisonicSource
Comment: Information about the source used for the IRs measurements

Name: GLOBAL_AmbisonicSourceOrder
Comment: Ambisonic order of the source

Name: GLOBAL_AmbisonicSourceConversionMethod
Comment: Description of the procedure used to transform source raw data into Ambisonics

Name: GLOBAL_License
Default: No license provided, ask the author for permission

Name: GLOBAL_RoomType
Comment: The room information can be arbitrary

Name: ListenerPosition
Default: [NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN]
Comment: ListenerPosition describes the positions of the listener in the room, each replicated a number of times equal to the number of source positions used for this listener position. M represents the number of valid listener/source pairs.

Name: ListenerUp
Comment: M represents the number of valid listener/source pairs.

Name: ListenerView
Comment: M represents the number of valid listener/source pairs.

Name: ReceiverPosition
Comment: Not applicable  (receivers are spherical harmonics)

Name: ReceiverPosition:Type
Comment: Not applicable  (receivers are spherical harmonics)

Name: ReceiverPosition:Units
Comment: Not applicable  (receivers are spherical harmonics)

Name: SourcePosition
Default: [NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN;NaN NaN NaN]
Comment: SourcePosition describes the positions of the source in the room. M represents the number of valid listener/source pairs.

Name: SourceUp
Comment: M represents the number of valid listener/source pairs.

Name: SourceView
Comment: M represents the number of valid listener/source pairs.

Name: EmitterPosition
Comment: Not applicable  (emitters are spherical harmonics)

Name: EmitterPosition:Type
Comment: Not applicable  (emitters are spherical harmonics)

Name: EmitterPosition:Units
Comment: Not applicable  (emitters are spherical harmonics)

Name: Data.IR
Comment: IRs data

Name: Data.IR:ListenerChannelOrdering
Comment: Describes the ordering of the Spherical Harmonics of the listener. Must be one of: 'acn', 'sid' or 'fuma'

Name: Data.IR:ListenerNormalization
Comment: Describes the normalization scheme of the Spherical Harmonics of the listener. Must be one of: 'sn3d', 'n3d', 'fuma' or 'maxn'

Name: Data.IR:SourceChannelOrdering
Comment: Describes the ordering of the Spherical Harmonics of the source. Must be one of: 'acn', 'sid' or 'fuma'

Name: Data.IR:SourceNormalization
Comment: Describes the normalization scheme of the Spherical Harmonics of the source. Must be one of: 'sn3d', 'n3d', 'fuma' or 'maxn'

Name: Data.SamplingRate
Comment: Sampling rate of the samples in Data.IR and Data.Delay

Name: Data.SamplingRate:Units
Comment: Unit of the sampling rate

Name: Data.Delay
Comment: Additional delay of each Ambisonic IR (in samples)

Name: RoomCornerA
Comment: Coordinates of one corner of the room (in case where GLOBAL_RoomType = 'shoebox')

Name: RoomCornerB
Comment: Coordinates of the opposite corner of the room (in case where GLOBAL_RoomType = 'shoebox')

Name: ListenerSourcePairIndex
Comment: Stores the indices along the M dimension of the IRs. Midx(i,j) corresponds to the ith listener position and jth source position. 0 means that the listener/source pair is not valid.
